</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In addition to the risks set forth above, we are subject to other risks and uncertainties as identified in our public filings with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.&#160; We do not assume any obligation to update any forward-looking statements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A NAME="FORM10K_HTM_ITEM7A_">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
<TABLE ID="Z0292BDBB78C24D829901BB2011C6000B" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 45PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	ITEM 7A
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<U>
	QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DISCLOSURES ABOUT MARKET RISK
</U>
</FONT>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In the normal course of business, we are subject to market exposure from changes in foreign exchange rates, interest rates, commodity prices, credit risk and economic conditions.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Foreign Currency Risk
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We are subject to the risk of changes in foreign currency exchange rates due to our operations in foreign countries. We have manufacturing facilities in Brazil, China, India, Mexico, South Africa, and throughout Europe.&#160; We also have joint ventures in China, Japan and South Korea.&#160; We sell and distribute products throughout the world and also purchase raw materials from foreign countries.&#160; As a result, our financial results are affected by changes in foreign currency exchange rates and economic conditions in the foreign markets in which we do business.&#160; We attempt to mitigate foreign currency risks on transactions with customers and suppliers in foreign countries by entering into contracts that are denominated in the functional currency of the subsidiary engaging in the transaction.&#160; Our financial results are principally exposed to changes in exchange rates between the U.S. dollar and European currencies, primarily the euro, and changes between the U.S. dollar and the Brazilian real, and between the euro and the British pound.&#160; In fiscal 2016, 2015, and 2014, more than 50 percent of our sales were generated in countries outside the U.S.&#160; A change in foreign exchange rates will positively or negatively affect our sales; however, this impact will be offset, usually to a large degree, with a corresponding effect on our expenses.&#160; In fiscal 2016, changes in foreign currencies negatively impacted our sales by $110 million; however, the impact on our operating income was only $4 million.&#160; Foreign currency exchange risk can be estimated by measuring the impact of a near-term adverse movement of 10 percent in foreign currency exchange rates.&#160; If these rates were 10 percent higher or lower during fiscal 2016, there would not have been a material impact on our fiscal 2016 earnings.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	35
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage40"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Content
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We maintain, from time to time, foreign-denominated, long-term debt obligations and long-term intercompany loans that are subject to foreign currency exchange risk.&#160; As of March 31, 2016, we did not have any long-term intercompany loans for which changes in foreign currency exchange rates would impact our net earnings.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	From time to time, we enter into currency rate derivative contracts to manage the foreign exchange rate exposure on these types of loans.&#160; These derivative instruments are typically not treated as hedges, and accordingly, gains
</FONT>
	or losses on the derivatives are recorded in other income and expense in the consolidated statements of operations and act to offset any currency movement on the outstanding loans receivable or payable.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Interest Rate Risk
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We actively seek to reduce the potential volatility of earnings that could arise from changes in interest rates.&#160; We generally utilize a mixture of debt maturities and both fixed-rate and floating-rate debt to manage exposure to changes in interest rates.&#160; Our domestic revolving credit facility is based on a variable interest rate of London Interbank Offered Rate (&#8220;LIBOR&#8221;) plus 125 to 225 basis points, depending on our leverage ratio.&#160; We are subject to risk of fluctuations in LIBOR and changes in our leverage ratio, which would affect the variable interest rate on our revolving credit facility and could create variability in interest expense.&#160; There were no borrowings outstanding under the revolving credit facility as of March 31, 2016.&#160; Based on our outstanding debt with variable interest rates at March 31, 2016, a 100 basis point increase in interest rates would increase our annual interest expense in fiscal 2017 by less than $1 million.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Commodity Price Risk
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We are dependent upon the supply of raw materials and supplies in the production process and, from time to time, enter into firm purchase commitments for aluminum, copper, nickel, and natural gas. We maintain agreements with certain customers to pass through specified raw material price fluctuations in order to mitigate commodity price risk.&#160; The majority of these agreements contain provisions in which the pass-through of the price fluctuations can lag behind the actual fluctuations by three months or longer, and typically the arrangements are limited to the underlying material cost based upon the London Metal Exchange.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Credit Risk
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Credit risk represents the possibility of loss from a customer failing to make payment according to contract terms.&#160; Our principal credit risk consists of outstanding trade accounts receivable.&#160; At March 31, 2016, 45 percent of our trade accounts receivable balance was concentrated with our top ten customers.&#160; These customers operate primarily in the automotive, commercial vehicle, and off-highway markets and are influenced by similar market and general economic factors.&#160; In the past, credit losses from our customers have not been significant.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We manage credit risk through a focus on the following:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="ZE59F6B149D1644F3854884CCF75A41BF" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 15.85PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Cash and investments
</FONT>
	&#8211; We review cash deposits and short-term investments to ensure banks have acceptable credit ratings, and short-term investments are maintained in secured or guaranteed instruments.&#160; We consider our holdings in cash and investments to be stable and secure at March 31, 2016;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="ZB31A976687F3484DAA269B4104F0F086" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 15.85PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Trade accounts receivable
</FONT>
	&#8211; Prior to granting credit, we evaluate each customer, taking into consideration the customer's financial condition, payment experience and credit information.&#160; After credit is granted, we actively monitor the customer's financial condition and applicable business news;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="Z45937F4F9372477AAC17AAC6027096EF" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 15.85PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Pension assets
</FONT>
	&#8211; We have retained outside advisors to assist in the management of the assets in our pension plans.&#160; In making investment decisions, we utilize an established risk management protocol that focuses on protection of the plan assets against downside risk.&#160; We ensure that investments within these plans provide appropriate diversification, the investments are monitored by investment teams, and portfolio managers adhere to the established investment policies.&#160; We believe the plan assets are subject to appropriate investment policies and controls; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="ZA6C7990CF1424944B062F9CEB30579B8" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 15.85PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Insurance
</FONT>
	&#8211; We monitor our insurance providers to ensure they have acceptable financial ratings.&#160; We have not identified any concerns in this regard based upon our reviews.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	36
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage41"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Content
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Economic Risk
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Economic risk represents the possibility of loss resulting from economic instability in certain areas of the world or downturns in markets in which we operate.&#160; We sell a broad range of products that provide thermal solutions to customers operating primarily in the commercial vehicle, automotive, off-highway, and building HVAC markets.&#160; We operate in diversified markets as a strategy for offsetting the risk associated with a downturn in any of the markets we serve.&#160; However, risk associated with market downturns, such as the global downturn experienced in fiscal 2009 and fiscal 2010, is still present.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We monitor economic conditions in the U.S., in our foreign markets and elsewhere.&#160; As we expand our global presence, we also encounter risks imposed by potential trade restrictions, including tariffs, embargoes and the like.&#160; We continue to pursue non-speculative opportunities to mitigate these economic risks, and capitalize, when possible, on changing market conditions.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We pursue new market opportunities after careful consideration of the potential associated risks and benefits.&#160; Successes in new markets are dependent upon our ability to commercialize our investments.&#160; Current examples of new and emerging markets for us include those related to waste heat recovery, coils, and the Chinese and Indian markets.&#160; Our investment in these areas is subject to the risks associated with business integration, technological success, customer and market acceptance, and our ability to meet the demands of our customers as these markets grow.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We anticipate that recovery within some of our geographic and end markets, and particularly growth in China may put production pressure on certain suppliers of our raw materials.&#160; In particular, there are a limited number of suppliers of aluminum, copper, and steel material.&#160; We are exposed to the risk of suppliers of certain raw materials not being able to meet customer demand as they may not increase their output capacity as quickly as customers increase their orders, and of increased prices being charged by raw material suppliers.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In addition, we purchase parts from suppliers that use our tooling to create the parts.&#160; In most instances, and for financial reasons, we do not have duplicate tooling for the manufacture of the purchased parts.&#160; As a result, we are exposed to the risk of a supplier being unable to provide the quantity or quality of parts that we require.&#160; Even in situations where suppliers are manufacturing parts without the use of our tooling, we face the challenge of obtaining consistently high-quality parts from suppliers that are financially stable.&#160; We utilize a supplier risk management program that leverages internal and third-party tools to identify and mitigate higher-risk supplier situations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In addition to the above risks on the supply side, we are also exposed to risks associated with demands by our customers for decreases in the price of our products.&#160; We attempt to offset this risk with firm agreements with our customers whenever possible, but these agreements often contain provisions for future price reductions.&#160; In addition, customers occasionally link price reductions to future program awards, and we must assess the overall implications of such requests on a case-by-case basis.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Hedging and Foreign Currency Forward Contracts
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We use derivative financial instruments as a tool to manage certain financial risks.&#160; We prohibit the use of leveraged derivatives.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Commodity derivatives:
</FONT>
	From time to time, we enter into futures contracts related to certain forecasted purchases of aluminum and copper.&#160; Our strategy is to reduce our exposure to changing market prices for future purchases of these commodities.&#160; In fiscal 2016, 2015, and 2014, expenses related to commodity derivative contracts totaled less than $1 million each year.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Foreign currency forward contracts:
</FONT>
	Our foreign exchange risk management strategy uses derivative financial instruments in a limited way to mitigate foreign currency exchange risk.&#160; We periodically enter into foreign currency exchange contracts to hedge specific foreign currency-denominated assets and liabilities.&#160; We have not designated these forward contracts as hedges.&#160; Accordingly, we record unrealized gains and losses related to the change in the fair value of the contracts in other income and expense.&#160; Gains and losses on these foreign currency forward contracts are offset by foreign currency gains and losses associated with the related assets and liabilities.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Counterparty risks:
</FONT>
	We manage counterparty risks by ensuring that counterparties to derivative instruments have credit ratings acceptable to us.&#160; At March 31, 2016, all counterparties had a sufficient long-term credit rating.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	37
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage42"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

	Table of Content
</A>
</DIV>

</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 1%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 9%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	238.2
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 1%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	&#160;
</TD>
</TR>

<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; WIDTH: 36PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	Note 1:
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">

<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Nature of operations:
</FONT>
	&#160; Modine Manufacturing Company (&#8220;Modine&#8221; or the &#8220;Company&#8221;) specializes in thermal management systems and components, bringing heating and cooling technology and solutions to diversified global markets.&#160; The Company is a leading global developer, manufacturer and marketer of heat exchangers and systems for use in on-highway and off-highway original equipment manufacturer (&#8220;OEM&#8221;) vehicular applications, and a wide array of building, industrial and refrigeration markets.&#160; The Company&#8217;s product lines include radiators and radiator cores, condensers, oil coolers, charge air coolers, heat-transfer modules and assemblies, exhaust gas recirculation (&#8220;EGR&#8221;) coolers, building heating, ventilating and air conditioning (&#8220;HVAC&#8221;) equipment, and coils.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Basis of presentation:
</FONT>
	&#160; The Company prepares its consolidated financial statements in conformity with generally accepted accounting principles (&#8220;GAAP&#8221;) in the United States.&#160; These principles require management to make certain estimates and assumptions in determining assets, liabilities, revenue, expenses and related disclosures.&#160; Actual amounts could differ materially from those estimates.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Consolidation principles:
</FONT>
	&#160; The consolidated financial statements include the accounts of Modine Manufacturing Company and its majority-owned or Modine-controlled subsidiaries.&#160; The Company eliminates intercompany transactions and balances in consolidation.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company accounts for investments in non-consolidated affiliated companies in which its ownership is 20 percent or more using the equity method.&#160; The Company states these investments at cost, plus or minus a proportionate share of undistributed net income (loss).&#160; The Company includes Modine&#8217;s share of the affiliate&#8217;s net income in other income and expense.&#160; See Note 12 for additional information.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Discontinued operations:
</FONT>
	During fiscal 2009, the Company sold its Electronics Cooling business.&#160; The buyer financed a portion of the selling price by issuing promissory notes payable to Modine.&#160; During fiscal 2015, the Company received $1.5 million from the buyer, which represented the final payment on the promissory notes.&#160; The Company had previously recorded a reserve against a portion of the promissory notes due to collectability concerns.&#160; As a result, the Company recorded a gain of $0.9 million ($0.6 million after income taxes) during fiscal 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Assets held for sale:&#160;
</FONT>
	The Company considers assets to be held for sale when management approves and commits to a formal plan to actively market the assets for sale at a price reasonable in relation to its fair value, the asset is available for immediate sale in its present condition, an active program to locate a buyer and other actions required to complete the sale have been initiated, the sale of the asset is expected to be completed within one year and it is unlikely that significant changes will be made to the plan.&#160; Upon designation as held for sale, the Company records the carrying value of the assets at the lower of its carrying value or its estimated fair value, less costs to sell, within other noncurrent assets.&#160; The Company ceases to record depreciation expense at the time of designation as held for sale.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Revenue recognition:
</FONT>
	&#160; The Company recognizes sales revenue, including agreed upon commodity prices, when it is both earned and realized or realizable.&#160; The Company&#8217;s policy is to recognize revenue when title to the product and risk of loss have transferred to the customer, persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists, and collection of the sales proceeds is reasonably assured, all of which generally occur upon shipment of goods to customers.&#160; The Company makes appropriate provisions for uncollectible accounts receivable based on historical data or specific customer economic data.&#160; The Company records sales discounts, which are offered for prompt payment by certain customers, as a reduction to net sales.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Tooling costs:
</FONT>
	&#160; The Company accounts for production tooling costs as a component of property, plant and equipment when it owns title to the tooling and amortizes the capitalized cost to cost of sales over the estimated life of the asset, which is generally three years.&#160; At March 31, 2016 and 2015, Company-owned tooling totaled $18.8 million and $18.7 million, respectively.&#160; In certain instances, the Company makes upfront payments for customer-owned tooling costs, and subsequently receives reimbursement from customers for the upfront payments.&#160; The Company accounts for unbilled customer-owned tooling costs as a receivable within other current assets when the customer has guaranteed reimbursement to the Company.&#160; No significant arrangements exist where customer-owned tooling costs were not accompanied by guaranteed reimbursement.&#160; At March 31, 2016 and 2015, cost reimbursement receivables related to customer-owned tooling totaled $8.5 million and $11.6 million, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Warranty:
</FONT>
	&#160; The Company provides product warranties for specific product lines and accrues for estimated future warranty costs in the period in which the sale is recorded.&#160; The Company records warranty expense based upon historical and current claims data or based upon estimated future claims.&#160; Accrual balances, which are recorded within other current liabilities, are monitored and adjusted if it is probable that expected claims will differ from previous estimates.&#160; See Note 15 for additional information.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 9PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 9PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	43
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage48"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Content
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	MODINE MANUFACTURING COMPANY
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	(In millions, except per share amounts)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Shipping and handling costs:&#160;
</FONT>
	The Company records shipping and handling costs incurred upon the shipment of products to its OEM customers in cost of sales, and related amounts billed to these customers in net sales.&#160; The Company records shipping and handling costs incurred upon the shipment of products to its HVAC customers in selling, general and administrative (&#8220;SG&amp;A&#8221;) expenses.&#160; For the years ended March 31, 2016, 2015, and 2014, shipping and handling costs recorded in SG&amp;A expenses were $2.5 million, $4.9 million, and $4.0 million, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Research and development:
</FONT>
	&#160; The Company expenses research and development costs as incurred within SG&amp;A expenses.&#160; For the years ended March 31, 2016, 2015, and 2014, research and development costs charged to operations totaled $61.1 million, $62.0 million, and $61.7 million, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Translation of foreign currencies:
</FONT>
	&#160; The Company translates assets and liabilities of foreign subsidiaries and equity investments into U.S. dollars at the period-end exchange rates, and translates income and expense items at the monthly average exchange rate for the period in which the transactions occur.&#160; The Company reports resulting translation adjustments within accumulated other comprehensive income (loss) within shareholders' equity.&#160; The Company includes foreign currency transaction gains or losses in the statement of operations within other income and expense.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Derivative instruments:
</FONT>
	&#160; The Company enters into derivative financial instruments from time to time to manage certain financial risks.&#160; The Company enters into futures contracts to reduce exposure to changing future purchase prices for aluminum and copper and into foreign currency exchange contracts to hedge specific foreign currency-denominated assets and liabilities.&#160; These instruments are used to manage financial risks and are not speculative.&#160; See Note 18 for additional information.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Income taxes:&#160;
</FONT>
	The Company determines deferred tax assets and liabilities based upon the difference between the amounts reported in the financial statements and the tax basis of assets and liabilities, using enacted tax rates in effect in the years in which the differences are expected to reverse.&#160; The Company establishes a valuation allowance if it is more likely than not that a deferred tax asset, or portion thereof, will not be realized.&#160; See Note 8 for additional information.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Earnings per share:
</FONT>
	&#160; The Company calculates basic earnings per share based upon the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding during the period, while the calculation of diluted earnings per share includes the dilutive effect of potential common shares outstanding during the period.&#160; The calculation of diluted earnings per share excludes all potential common shares if their inclusion would have an anti-dilutive effect.&#160; Restricted stock award recipients have a non-forfeitable right to receive dividends declared by the Company.&#160; Therefore, these restricted stock awards are included in computing earnings per share pursuant to the two-class method.&#160; See Note 9 for additional information.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Cash and cash equivalents:
</FONT>
	The Company considers all highly-liquid investments with original maturities of three months or less to be cash equivalents.&#160; Under the Company&#8217;s cash management system, cash balances at certain banks are funded when checks are presented for payment.&#160; To the extent checks issued, but not yet presented for payment, exceed the balance on hand at the specific bank against which they were written, the amount of those un-presented checks is included in accounts payable.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Short-term investments:&#160;
</FONT>
	The Company invests in time deposits with original maturities of more than three months but no more than one year.&#160; The Company records these short-term investments at cost, which approximates fair value, within other current assets in the consolidated balance sheets.&#160; As of March 31, 2016 and 2015, the Company&#8217;s short-term investments totaled $3.3 million and $2.8 million, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Deferred compensation trust:&#160;
</FONT>
	The Company maintains a deferred compensation trust to fund future obligations under its non-qualified deferred compensation plan.&#160; The trust&#8217;s investments in third-party debt and equity securities are presented within other noncurrent assets in the consolidated balance sheets.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Trade accounts receivable:&#160;
</FONT>
	The Company records trade receivables at the invoiced amount.&#160; Trade receivables do not bear interest if paid according to the original terms.&#160; The Company recorded an allowance for doubtful accounts of $0.5 million and $1.0 million at March 31, 2016 and 2015, respectively, representing its estimated uncollectible receivables.&#160; The Company enters into supply chain financing programs from time to time to sell accounts receivable without recourse to third-party financial institutions.&#160; Sales of accounts receivable are reflected as a reduction of accounts receivable on the consolidated balance sheets and the proceeds are included in cash flows from operating activities in the consolidated statements of cash flows.&#160; During the years ended March 31, 2016, 2015, and 2014, the Company sold, without recourse, $71.3 million, $87.0 million, and $82.4 million of accounts receivable to accelerate cash receipts.&#160; During each of the years ended March 31, 2016, 2015, and 2014, the Company recorded a loss on the sale of accounts receivables of $0.3 million in the consolidated statements of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 9PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 9PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	44
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage49"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Content
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	MODINE MANUFACTURING COMPANY
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	(In millions, except per share amounts)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Inventories:
</FONT>
	The Company values inventories using a first-in, first-out or weighted-average basis, at the lower of cost and net realizable value.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Property, plant and equipment
</FONT>
	:&#160; The Company records property, plant and equipment at cost.&#160; For financial reporting purposes, the Company computes depreciation using the straight-line method over the expected useful life of the asset.&#160; The Company charges maintenance and repair costs to operations as incurred.&#160; The Company capitalizes costs of improvements.&#160; Upon the sale or other disposition of an asset, the Company removes the cost and related accumulated depreciation from the accounts and includes the gain or loss in the consolidated statements of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Goodwill:
</FONT>
	&#160; The Company does not amortize goodwill; rather, it tests for impairment annually unless conditions exist that would require a more frequent evaluation.&#160; The Company performs an assessment of the fair value of its reporting units for goodwill impairment testing based upon, among other things, the present value of expected future cash flows.&#160; The Company performed its goodwill impairment test as of March 31, 2016, which did not result in an impairment charge.&#160; See Note 14 for additional information.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Impairment of long-lived assets:
</FONT>
	&#160; The Company reviews long-lived assets, including property, plant and equipment and intangible assets, for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of the asset may not be fully recoverable.&#160; In these instances, the Company compares the undiscounted future cash flows expected to be generated from the asset with its carrying value.&#160; If the asset&#8217;s carrying value exceeds expected future cash flows, the Company measures and records an impairment loss, if any, as the amount by which the carrying value of the asset exceeds its fair value.&#160; The Company estimates fair value using a variety of valuation techniques, including discounted cash flows, market values and comparison values for similar assets.&#160; See Note 6 for additional information.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Environmental liabilities:
</FONT>
	&#160; The Company records liabilities for environmental assessments and remediation efforts in the period which its responsibility is probable and the costs can be reasonably estimated.&#160; To the extent that the required remediation procedures change, or additional contamination is identified, the Company&#8217;s estimate of environmental liabilities may change.&#160; See Note 19 for additional information.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Self-insurance reserves:
</FONT>
	&#160; The Company retains a portion of the financial risk for various insurance coverage, including property, general liability, workers compensation, and employee healthcare, and therefore maintains reserves that estimate the impact of unreported and under-reported claims that fall below various stop-loss limits and deductibles under its insurance policies.&#160; The Company maintains reserves for the estimated settlement cost of known claims, as well as estimates of incurred but not reported claims.&#160; The Company charges costs of claims, including the impact of changes in reserves due to claim experience and severity, to operations.&#160; The Company reviews and updates the amount of its insurance-related reserves on a quarterly basis.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Stock-based compensation:
</FONT>
	&#160; The Company recognizes stock-based compensation using the fair value method.&#160; Accordingly, compensation expense for stock options, restricted stock and performance-based stock awards is calculated based upon the fair value of the instruments at the time of grant, and is recognized as expense over the respective vesting periods.&#160; See Note 5 for additional information.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	New accounting guidance:
</FONT>
	&#160; In March 2016, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (&#8220;FASB&#8221;) issued new guidance to simplify several aspects of accounting for share-based payment transactions, including the income tax consequences.&#160; This guidance is effective for the Company&#8217;s first quarter of fiscal 2018.&#160; The Company is currently evaluating the impact this guidance will have on its consolidated financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In February 2016, the FASB issued new comprehensive lease accounting guidance that supersedes existing lease accounting guidance.&#160; Upon adoption of this new guidance, the Company will be required to recognize most leases on its balance sheet.&#160; This guidance is effective for the Company&#8217;s first quarter of fiscal 2020.&#160; The Company is currently evaluating the impact this guidance will have on its consolidated financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In November 2015, the FASB issued new guidance, as part of its simplification initiative, that requires all deferred tax assets and liabilities to be classified as noncurrent on the balance sheet.&#160; The Company adopted this guidance, on a retrospective basis, for its fiscal year ending March 31, 2016.&#160; As a result, the Company reclassified approximately $13.0 million of deferred tax assets from current assets to noncurrent assets as of March 31, 2015 to conform to the current-period presentation.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 9PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 9PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	45
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage50"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Content
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	MODINE MANUFACTURING COMPANY
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	(In millions, except per share amounts)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In May 2014, the FASB issued new guidance that outlines a comprehensive model for entities to use in accounting for revenue arising from contracts with customers.&#160; The core principle of the new guidance is that companies are to recognize revenue to depict the transfer of goods or services to customers in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services. The new guidance also includes a cohesive set of disclosure requirements intended to provide users of financial statements with comprehensive information about revenue arising from contracts with customers.&#160; This new guidance is effective for the Company&#8217;s first quarter of fiscal 2019.&#160; The Company is currently evaluating the impact this guidance will have on its consolidated financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Supplemental cash flow information:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<TABLE ID="ZF36FC47428AE4FE18E5991D269C1C25A" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 80%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="LEFT" BORDER="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; WIDTH: 44%" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; WIDTH: 1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&#160;
</TD>

</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; CLEAR: BOTH">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="ZB7C66989891C48579F718892C696F84A" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; WIDTH: 36PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	Note 2:
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Airedale Facility Fire
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	On September 6, 2013, a fire caused significant destruction to the Company&#8217;s Airedale manufacturing facility and offices in Rawdon (Leeds), United Kingdom.&#160; The Company reports Airedale&#8217;s financial results within the Building HVAC segment.&#160; There were no injuries caused by the fire.&#160; The Rawdon facility, which is leased, was used to manufacture cooling products and solutions for a variety of applications, including data centers, clean rooms, retail, leisure and process cooling. The Company suspended operations at the Rawdon site as a result of the fire; however, it transferred operations to temporary facilities while it rebuilt the leased facility.&#160; The Company completed the reconstruction and relocation to the Rawdon facility in fiscal 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company&#8217;s insurance covered damage to the leased facility, equipment, inventory, and other assets, as well as business interruption and lost profits, and recovery-related expenses caused by the fire.&#160; Since the date of the fire, the Company has received cumulative cash proceeds of $96.0 million from its insurance provider for covered losses, and has recorded losses and costs caused by the fire in the same statement of operations line as the related insurance recovery.&#160; In fiscal 2016, the Company recorded a $9.5 million gain within other income related to an insurance settlement for equipment losses.&#160; This gain represents the replacement assets&#8217; cost in excess of the carrying value of the equipment at the time it was destroyed by the fire.&#160; During fiscal 2015, the Company recorded $4.6 million of recoveries from business interruption insurance relating to fiscal 2015 and 2014 lost profits within SG&amp;A expenses.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The terms of the Rawdon lease agreement obligated the Company to rebuild the damaged facility.&#160; Upon completion of the rebuilt facility in fiscal 2016, the Company fulfilled this obligation and removed both the liability to rebuild the facility and the capitalized reconstruction costs from its consolidated balance sheet.&#160; As of March 31, 2015, the other current liability to rebuild the facility was $48.0 million and other current assets related to receivables from the Company&#8217;s insurance provider and capitalized reconstructions costs totaled $39.2 million.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="ZF446965FD91B4D809F05BAC2DAB5D4B7" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; WIDTH: 36PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	Note 3:
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Acquisitions
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	On January 29, 2016, the Company formed a joint venture, Modine Puxin Thermal Systems (Jiangsu) Co. Ltd. of Yangzhou, China, of which it owns 67%, and the joint venture partner, Jiangsu Puxin Heat Exchange System Co., Ltd, owns 33%.&#160; This joint venture, which is reported in the Asia segment, will expedite the Company&#8217;s introduction of stainless steel heat exchangers for the light-, medium-, and heavy-duty commercial vehicle markets in China.&#160; The Company contributed cash of $1.4 million, with additional cash consideration of $0.5 million payable after six months subject to the sellers&#8217; indemnification obligations under the agreement, and equipment and other assets totaling $2.3 million.&#160; The Company recorded assets acquired and liabilities assumed at their respective fair values.&#160; The purchase price allocation resulted in acquired equipment and other long-lived assets totaling $1.5 million and working capital net assets of $0.8 million.&#160; The Company controls the primary management decisions and revenue-generating activities of the joint venture, and, therefore, the financial results of the joint venture are included in the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	On February 28, 2014, the Company acquired 100 percent of the shares of Barkell Limited of Consett, United Kingdom for cash consideration of $7.8 million, net of cash acquired.&#160; This acquisition provides Modine with an expanded product offering into the air handling market within the Building HVAC segment.&#160; The Company recorded assets acquired and liabilities assumed at their respective fair values.&#160; The purchase price allocation resulted in intangible assets for acquired technology and customer relationships totaling $4.7 million; property, plant and equipment of $2.0 million; and working capital net assets of $1.1 million.&#160; Acquired technology consists of a fully developed product line and technical processes, and the customer relationships represent established sales channel and customer relationships. The Company is amortizing these acquired intangible assets over ten years.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 9PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 9PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	46
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Content
</A>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	MODINE MANUFACTURING COMPANY
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	(In millions, except per share amounts)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The results of operations of these acquired businesses are included in the Company&#8217;s consolidated statements of operations since the dates of acquisition. The Company did not present pro forma financial information as the effect of these acquisitions is not material to its results of operations or financial position.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="Z9280F4FE917349F18C82981A513477E9" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; WIDTH: 36PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	Note 4:
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Fair Value Measurements
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Fair value is defined as the price that would be received for an asset or paid to transfer a liability in the principal or most advantageous market for the asset or liability in an orderly transaction between market participants.&#160; Fair value measurements are classified under the following hierarchy:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="Z4D2089FB4F044EEDAAAFD59BE9E866A3" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#9679;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	Level 1 &#8211; Quoted prices for identical instruments in active markets.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="Z80ECD1DC5F524BD48951C3F977016E1A" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#9679;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	Level 2 &#8211; Quoted prices for similar instruments in active markets; quoted prices for identical or similar instruments in markets that are not active; and model-derived valuations in which all significant inputs are observable in active markets.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="Z5F8F228E19504EBEB4CBD74C563D7CE2" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#9679;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	Level 3 &#8211; Model-derived valuations in which one or more significant inputs are not observable.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	When available, the Company uses quoted market prices to determine fair value and classifies such measurements as Level 1.&#160; In some cases, where market prices are not available, the Company uses observable market-based inputs to calculate fair value, in which case the measurements are classified as Level 2.&#160; If quoted or observable market prices are not available, fair value is based upon valuation models that use, where possible, market-based data such as interest rates, yield curves or currency rates.&#160; These measurements are classified as Level 3.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	The carrying values of cash and cash equivalents, short-term investments, trade accounts receivable, accounts payable, and short-term debt approximate fair value due to the short-term nature of these instruments.&#160; The Company holds trading securities in a deferred compensation trust to fund obligations under Modine&#8217;s non-qualified deferred compensation plan.&#160; The securities&#8217; fair values, which are recorded as other noncurrent assets, are determined based on quoted prices from active markets and classified within Level 1 of the valuation hierarchy.&#160; The Company&#8217;s deferred compensation obligations,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	which are recorded as other noncurrent liabilities, are recorded at the fair values of the investments held by the trust.&#160; The fair values of the Company&#8217;s trading securities and deferred compensation obligations each totaled $3.2 million and $3.0 million at March 31, 2016 and 2015, respectively.&#160; The fair value of the Company&#8217;s long-term debt is disclosed in Note 16.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Plan assets related to the Company&#8217;s pension plans were classified as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; CLEAR: BOTH">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company determined the fair value of money market investments to approximate their net asset values, without discounts for credit quality or liquidity restrictions, and classified them within Level 2 of the valuation hierarchy.&#160; The Company determined the fair value of common stocks, pooled equity funds and pooled fixed-income funds based on quoted prices from active markets and classified them within Level 1 of the valuation hierarchy.&#160; The Company determined the fair value of certain common stocks, corporate bonds, pooled equity funds and U.S. government and agency securities based upon recent bid prices or the average of recent bid and asking prices when available and, if not available, the Company valued them through matrix pricing models developed by sources considered by management to be reliable.&#160; The Company classified these assets within Level 2 of the valuation hierarchy.&#160; As of March 31, 2016 and 2015, the Company held no Level 3 assets within its pension plans.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Assets held for sale:
</FONT>
	&#160; The Company valued assets held for sale based on Level 3 market-based valuation inputs.&#160; The carrying value of assets held for sale totaled $8.5 million and $3.2 million at March 31, 2016 and 2015, respectively.&#160; See Note 6 for additional information.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="Z2479B3579A584745BB8CDBEAFF9EB253" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; WIDTH: 36PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	Note 5:
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	Stock-Based Compensation
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company&#8217;s stock-based incentive programs consist of the following: (1) a long-term incentive compensation program for officers and executives that consists of restricted stock and stock options granted for retention and performance, (2) a discretionary equity program for management and other key employees, and (3) stock awards and/or stock options for non-employee directors.&#160; The Company&#8217;s Board of Directors and the Officer Nomination and Compensation Committee, as applicable, have discretionary authority to set the terms of the awards of stock under the Company&#8217;s Amended and Restated 2008 Incentive Compensation Plan (&#8220;Plan&#8221;).&#160; At present, the Company accomplishes the fulfillment of equity-based grants through the issuance of new common shares.&#160; As of March 31, 2016, approximately 3.3 million shares authorized under the Plan remain available for future grants. Employee participants have the opportunity to deliver back to the Company the number of shares from the vesting of stock awards sufficient to satisfy the individual&#8217;s minimum tax withholding obligations.&#160; These shares are held as treasury shares.&#160; The Company recorded stock-based compensation expense of $4.9 million, $4.0 million, and $3.6 million in fiscal 2016, 2015, and 2014, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Stock Options:
</FONT>
	&#160; The Company recorded $0.9 million, $0.9 million, and $0.8 million of compensation expense related to stock options in fiscal 2016, 2015, and 2014, respectively.&#160; The fair value of stock options that vested during fiscal 2016, 2015, and 2014 was $0.9 million, $0.9 million, and $0.8 million, respectively.&#160; As of March 31, 2016, the total compensation expense not yet recognized related to non-vested stock options was $2.0 million and the weighted-average period in which the remaining expense is expected to be recognized was 2.5 years.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company estimated the fair value of option awards on the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option valuation model and the following assumptions:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>

<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Content
</A>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	MODINE MANUFACTURING COMPANY
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	(In millions, except per share amounts)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Stock options expire no later than 10 years after the grant date and have an exercise price equal to the fair market value of the common stock on the date of grant.&#160; The risk-free interest rate was based on yields of U.S. Treasury zero-coupon issues with a term corresponding to the expected life of the options.&#160; The expected volatility assumption was based on changes in the Company&#8217;s historical common stock prices over the same time frame as the expected life of the awards.&#160; The expected dividend yield is zero as the Company currently does not anticipate paying dividends over the expected life of the options.&#160; The expected lives of the awards are based on historical patterns and the terms of the options.&#160; Outstanding options granted vest 25 percent annually for four years.&#160; The Company used a pre-vesting forfeiture rate of 2.5 percent as an estimate of expected forfeitures prior to completing the required service period.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	A summary of stock option activity for fiscal 2016 was as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<BR>
</DIV>

<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The aggregate intrinsic value represents the difference between the closing price of Modine&#8217;s common shares on the last trading day of fiscal 2016 over the exercise price of the stock options, multiplied by the number of options outstanding or exercisable.&#160; The aggregate intrinsic value is not recorded for financial statement purposes, and this value will change based upon daily changes in the fair value of Modine&#8217;s common shares.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Restricted Stock:
</FONT>
	&#160; The Company recorded $3.5 million, $2.8 million, and $2.2 million of compensation expense related to restricted stock in fiscal 2016, 2015, and 2014, respectively.&#160; The fair value of restricted stock awards that vested during fiscal 2016, 2015, and 2014 was $3.4 million, $2.3 million, and $1.6 million, respectively.&#160; At March 31, 2016, the Company had $4.7 million of unrecognized compensation expense related to non-vested restricted stock, which it expects to recognize over a weighted-average period of 2.4 years.&#160; The Company values restricted stock awards using the closing market value of its common shares on the date of grant.&#160; The restricted stock awards vest 25 percent annually for four years, with the exception of awards to non-employee directors, which fully vest upon grant.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
